intro: Podanthum linifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaf podanthum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its delicate, trailing stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in spring and summer. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes collected for horticultural purposes, which can threaten its natural populations.
